borderline personality disorder comes

abandonment the number one symptom in
BPD is if you're of Abandonment an
article from verywell mind explains that
people with BPD are sensitive to and try
to avoid abandonment whether it's real
or imagined what constitutes abandonment
can vary and can be subtle for instance
if they perceive your tone in a text
message to be off they may think you're
upset with them other ways people avoid

for reassurance and excessively
apologizing the fear of Abandonment can

Reckless like spend excessively or drink

the fear of Abandonment often leads to
the other symptoms in
BPD they seem hot and cold BPD is tricky
for both the person experiencing the
condition and the one dating them one
minute they treat you like your royalty
and they adore you deeply and admire
your every move they seem to get you and
understand you like no other this is
called
idealization and from their perspective
they really do think this however on the
flip side they may suddenly turn cold
they may think that you're an uncaring
person and that all of your negative
qualities are suddenly overpowering
anything positive this is called
devaluation the switch between this
idealization and devaluation is called
splitting splitting is triggered by by

you're constantly bouncing back and

knowing and understanding the illness is

their moods shift quickly having
borderline personality disorder does not
mean that you experience different
emotions than everyone else it simply
means that you sometimes experience
stronger or more intense emotions than
many other people according to the
optimum performance Institute this can
mean that moods in BPD shift quickly
especially once the fear of Abandonment
is triggered they may be having a great
day but are quickly derailed by a missed
phone call or an unpleasant interaction
at work one of these mood shifts can
last just a few minutes but others may
take hours to return to a calmer place
in an article by the clear viiew woman

may have perception shifts and feel that

because of these mood swings people with

the good news is that treatment is there
BPD is a chronic mental health disorder
and should be treated as such the good
news is that BPD is highly responsive to
treatment and the prognosis for it is
better than many other mental health
conditions in fact the clear viiew women
Center explains that when receiving
proper treatment and awareness 90% of
people with BPD can achieve remission
for at least a 2-year period with 85
keeping it for at least four different
forms of psychotherapy like dialectical
behavior therapy help increase
mindfulness stress tolerance and
acceptance which have profound effects
